name: Davy Thurmond
text: Our shop purchased a rear differential for a 04 Pontiac GTO from Parts Now LLC. When they showed up the diff was already out of the vehicle we were working on, so we sent it with them. Kyle our tech installed the diff and drove it the same day. Of course when we drove the car we noticed that the  rear end was screaming so we brought it back to inspect it Before we called him. We brought it in lifted it up and made sure it was definitely the supplied rear end and it was for sure. We then called and the owner of Parts Now LLC agreed to supply us with another diff a couple days later since the one he supplied was faulty. A few days later we called and the diff was being loaded and on its way, well long story short it never showed up. We called the owner back and he told us since we did not use fluid from the dealer he would not swap it out. We use the same fluid we use for EVERY VEHICLE, fluid that meets our exceeds what the dealer recommends. Guess it all makes since because they just had to have cash. And now some unlucky person will get our diff and go through the same stuff we have. This business does not care about customers. We told him hes screwing over a military vet and he just hung up. Goes to show what type of people they really are.

resp.text: Manufactures put fluid requirements on products for a reason. We don't make them, but we do follow them. Thank you for taking time to review and lay out that you put the wrong fluid in a part, and we would not warranty it. That is absolutely correct.

name: Levi Richardson
text: Ordered an engine from them and waited 3 weeks for it to arrive. On the day it was supposed to arrive at 1pm, it never showed up. I called several times and they kept informing me they would call back which they never did. I am currently waiting on a refund after their horrible customer service experience. I would never do business with them again.

resp.text: Unfortunately we are at the mercy of freight carriers sometimes and have no control over freight delays. I know you received a nice engine and were very happy with it. I am truly sorry we couldn't avoid a bad review over a time restraint. Thank you for shopping at Parts NOW! We are here for your service if you need us again.

name: Yvette G
text: Horrible experience. Went in for something super simple and can put with an even bigger problem. I purchased a windshield wiper arm. It was confirmed that the arm was for the year and make of my car. I asked if I could pay extra for him to put it on and he agreed. He wasn't able to put it on claiming that it was becuase I needed a nut. I noticed that the wipers were no longer working after he tried putting it on. He claimed the wiper motor was not working. The wiper motor was working completely fine prior to him touching my car. I took it to my trusted mechanic and it was confirmed that not only did the wiper arm Hammett sold me was NOT for my year and make car, but he also tore my wiper transmission when he ripped the arm off of it. Prior to me even going to Hammett, I took it by my mechanic to confirm what was needed. It was confirmed that I only needed the arm as the wiper motor and wiper transmission were perfectly fine in great condition, I had also driven the car in the rain the day before and the wiper worked just fine. I called and text  the guy who damaged the car and sent photos and I have yet to receive a response. Do not only did i pay $40 for an arm that doesn't fit my car (Oriellys Auto Parts confirmed that the Hammett arm was likely for a 2003 not a 2008), but I also had to pay $75 for the part Hammett broke as well as $75 for a brand new arm from The dealership. This was a $40 fix that ended up costing me $190! This is a real review. I would not suggest taking your car or buying any parts from this company. The honest thing to do would have been to at the very LEAST reimburse me for the arm that didn't fit the car. I gave them that opportunity by calling and texting prior to this review and I didn't receive any response back.

name: coldcuts coldcuts
text: Outstanding customer service.  I was blown away at how he truly did everything he could to help me during a tough spot.  My family and I were traveling to Florida this past summer and had the transmission go out right south of Dothan on highway 230.  I started calling shops but of course it was Sunday.  Gary happened to be in his shop and answered.  Even though he was only there for a short errand, he waited for me to bring the car by.  Though he couldn't fix it right then, he called the local rental car agency and helped me get a rental.  I went on to Florida and he conducted diagnostics and held it for the whole week.  He offered straightforward advice on the repair.  I chose to sell the car since it was older.  He had it in enough working order for me to get it to a local dealer to sell it.  Through it all he answered many calls and went through much effort for virtually no money to help us out and save our vacation and I am extremely grateful.

name: April Renfro
text: I purchased an engine from here, was guaranteed motor was good. Paid for it over the phone and picked it up the next day. After getting the motor in it was knocking called and talked to a lady who said owner wasn’t in and he’ll give me a call back, he never called me back. I called a couple days later and he answered I let him know what was going on and he said you only have a 30 day warranty, when in fact my paperwork states I had 60. Thank god I had kept the receipt. He told me I had to fill out the warranty paperwork and present receipts. Ok no problem but on the warranty form it states that the timing belt needs to be replaced, this engine has a chain. He informed me that regardless belt or chain it’s all the same. Well I got some news from you buddy there not, a chain shouldn’t have to be serviced under normal conditions, a belt yes I agree it does. But if the motor is knocking that has nothing to do with it. This is a fair warning for anyone purchasing from here he will not refund your money and will think of any way possible not too, and he uses the square app which makes things much harder to get a refund through your credit card. But I am happy to say after over 8 months I have received my refund and hope this guy flies out of business and really feels it. I tried to do the rite thing and not go through my card company but in the end they took care of it. And I really hope this guy goes out of business.

resp.text: Hi April.  We do not have a record of you ever purchasing anything with us.  We recommend that if any item is purchased from American Salvage and is under warranty that it be brought back to our location for inspection.

Andy,
Sorry to see this review.  Part was out of warranty and an extended warranty was declined at time of purchase.  We did not and never had advertised a life time warranty.  Surely you are aware that it is standard for a business not to warranty items that are out of warranty. name: Eric Browne
text: I do not recommend this company...its the worst company to buy parts from...they do not. Test their engines... They sold me a used engine for my landcruser THAT  i am rebuilding and when it was time to install the engine....4 cylinders OF THE SIX had very poor compression....when i called them the did not honor their bad engine...now i am oUT of 1200 dollars and no engine...they do not deserve a single star....do not make the same mistake i made.....THEY SELL BAD ENGINES..

resp.text:
Hello,

Wow,  let's start by stating you purchased this engine over a year ago and just contacted us about it last night. We had video proof of this engine running perfectly (that we sent you); therefore, we know for a fact that the engine did not have "low compression" nor is "complete trash" like you stated on the phone. Also, you stated an hour ago and yesterday, on the phone, that the engine had "low compression" on one cylinder. Now you're stating in this review it's low on 4 of the 6 cylinders?

This is where the situation became "interesting:" A few weeks ago a gentleman named Michael from Atlanta, GA called us. He stated that Mr. Browne was trying to sell him a used Land Cruiser engine, and Eric was advertising the engine as only having 60,000 miles on it (Eric knew 100% that our engine we sold him had over 185,000 miles.......). Michael saw our number on the invoice and deciding to check it out for himself. Michael later told me, "I knew those low miles were too good to be true." A long story short,  Michael informed me that Eric was trying to sell him the motor because Eric decided not to fix his own Land Cruiser. We find it interesting that after a year the motor was supposedly finally put in and now is no good. Eric was asking for an immediate refund--no questions asked. We politely informed Eric that the engine was outside of the 90 Day Warranty he selected on checkout. Eric responded with yelling, "you're a liar, you sell bad engines, and you do not value your customers."

I know this reply is longer than most; however, I hope this response brings clarity to those reading this review.

Thank you,

Heritage Auto Parts

Kevin,
Sorry to see this review.
You purchased an item on eBay without any prior contact from us regarding fitment.  The add clearly stated that it was for a certain Part Number and would only fit that Part Number. We always encourage customers to do research and verify what part is needed prior to ordering a part.  Explaining all of that in the listing is really the only way we can try to curtail this as we do not have a chance to talk to you prior to a purchase being made. Do you have a better suggestion on how to convey this?

You then contacted us about the issue LONG past any return period. As far as pricing, yes if you can buy local and not get hit with shipping and listing fees it is always going to be a better deal.

Hope this makes sense.

name: Sean Miller
text:
Would give them 0 stars if it were an option. I bought a used transmission from them, installed it and less than a week later the transmission is slipping heavily. No problem, returned the old one for a "new" one from them. Installed it and only made it around the block before it started slipping again. Frustrated I contact them for the third time about getting a WORKING transmission just to have them claim that something is wrong with the "installer or computer in the car".
Just to note, both transmissions were sent to me with broken clutch lock up solenoids, shift control solenoids, as well as dirt in axle bearings behind the seals, muck behind all the solenoids as well. On the first trans he sent me I had to swap over everything, assuming he would send me another trans complete with everything the second go round I didn't bother taking all the solenoids off. When I received the new one, of course all the solenoids were broken. So after having to go source and replace all the solenoids I kept them after having to return the last transmission. Today I went into his car yard and actually found all my undamaged sensors in his junk transmission. He wouldn't let me have another transmission until I gave him his sensors out of the older one. He then claimed that he had only sold me one transmision. And that he didn't have another transmission anymore.
Awful business, 0 stars

text: Most horrible rip off man there is. The guy who owns it is nothing more then a scam artist. I had broken down in Montgomery, I called around and found this man who said he would repair my vehicle. I had already located the parts. When I arrived with the tow truck he met me outside and said don't worry about the parts I found he had them. Well that was a lie he kept up for 3 days. But not before tearing my truck apart so I could not move it till the parts was repaired. In other words intentionally taking my truck apart so I would have zero choice but to let him repair it. After 3 days and constant lies, I finally went and got the parts so I could get back to Atlanta. After all 3 days I had lost Dale's and service calls. Well 4th day I got my truck and immediately started off to Atlanta. I didn't make it. There was nothing wrong with the breaks when I took the truck to him, it was the rear end had gone bad. Not I had ABS lights on, and by the time I got 20 miles away I had NO BREAKS!! SERIOUSLY I had to place the truck in neutral and coast to a stop on the interstate. I had the truck tow to Atlanta. The mechanic there break lines not tight and leaking fluid where Bama people had not bother to tighten the up. Bolts not put back properly and had cut into the tire, wires and emergency brake cables just taped up. And rubbing against the tire. Long story short. These people almost got me killed!!!
